summary: Build a Valentine's Week greeting website for Rimsha with daily greetings that remain locked until their specific day and then unlock automatically, plus an anniversary-date prompt gate that only allows access when the correct date (13 June 2021) is entered.
architectural_notes: Ensure any date examples shown in UI 'date' columns are neutral placeholders (no real personal/relationship data); keep the actual gate validation date (13 June 2020) internal to the access check.
Anniversary-date access gate UI should not show any example/placeholder date hint; only validate internally against the correct date.
Update internal access gate validation date to 13 June 2021 while still avoiding any UI hints/placeholders that reveal the correct date.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page website experience for Valentine’s Week that is personalized for the user’s girlfriend Rimsha and presents one greeting per day.
Implement date-based locking so each day’s greeting remains locked until its scheduled calendar day, then unlocks automatically and reveals only that day’s greeting content.
Provide a clear schedule definition for Valentine’s Week days and their corresponding dates, and use it consistently throughout the UI (labels, unlock dates, and ordering).
Apply a coherent romantic visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, and card styles) suitable for a Valentine’s Week greeting website, avoiding a generic default template look.
Add generated static image assets and use them in the UI to support the theme (served from frontend/public/assets/generated, referenced directly by the frontend).
On every page load, show an anniversary-date access gate that blocks the Valentine’s Week interface until the user enters the correct anniversary date: "13 June 2020".

Update the Valentine’s Week day card "date" display (the date column shown under each day title) so it does not use any real/personal/relationship-specific date content; use a neutral, non-personal placeholder format consistently across all days (e.g., month + day only, without a year), while keeping the actual unlocking logic based on `unlockDate` unchanged.
Remove any example or hint text for the anniversary date from the AnniversaryGate UI so the gate does not display a sample date or formatting guidance text.
Change the anniversary-date access gate validation so the only accepted anniversary date is "13 June 2021" (instead of "13 June 2020").

Update the Valentine’s Week schedule so that only the first day (Rose Day / id: "rose-day") includes an additional apology note in the unlocked greeting message. The apology note text must be in English and must express: "sorry for all the mistakes I have done before and I'll try to improve myself". No other day’s greeting message should include this apology note.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine's Week greeting website with per-day greetings that stay locked until their scheduled day, then unlock to reveal the correct message for Rimsha.
Add an anniversary-date access gate on site open: prompt for the anniversary date and only show the interface if the user enters 13 June 2020.
Avoid using real personal/relationship details in the date column; use a neutral/placeholder example date format instead of the 'real passion' date.
Remove any example/hint text for the anniversary date from the access gate UI (do not display an example date).
Change the anniversary-date access gate validation date from 13 June 2020 to 13 June 2021.
Add a short apology/sorry note ('sorry for all the mistakes I have done before and I'll try to improve myself') to the first day’s greeting only.

projectName: Valentine’s Week website with day-locked greetings for Rimsha
